data.title: From Dusk Till Dawn: The Graphic Novel
data.meta_description:
Read reviews from the world’s largest community 
    for readers. Two criminals and their hostages unknowingly seek temporary refuge at a strip club in Mexico p…
data.text:
Two criminals and their hostages unknowingly seek temporary refuge at a strip club in Mexico populated by vampires, with chaotic results.

Based upon the major motion picture written by Quentin Tarantino, directed by Robert Rodriguez and released by Miramax Films.

Quentin Jerome Tarantino is an Academy Award- and Palme d'Or-winning American film director, screenwriter and actor. He rose to fame in the early 1990s as an independent filmmaker whose films used nonlinear storylines and stylized violence. His films include Reservoir Dogs (1992), Pulp Fiction (1994), Jackie Brown (1997), Kill Bill (Vol. 1 2003, Vol. 2 2004), Death Proof (2007), and Inglourious Basterds (2009).
